New Records: Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh stitched together an unbeaten partnership of 190 runs against Afghanistan, breaking the record for highest T20I partnership for any wicket for India.
Rohit Sharma's 121* is the highest for the captain in the shortest format for India, but the fourth-highest individual score for India in T20Is.
The third T20I saw India posting the highest total for a team after being four down for 25 or less, reaching 212/4.
The duo of Rinku Singh and Rohit Sharma helped India score 36 runs in the final over of the match, breaking the record for Most runs scored in an over in T20Is.
Despite over 15 matches ending in a tie since the multiple Super Over rule came into existence, there had never been a double Super Over until the India vs Afghanistan clash in Bengaluru.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's unbeaten 190-run stand guided India to a total of 212 runs, capping off the innings by scoring 36 runs in the final over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With this series win, India now have 9 whitewash series wins in T20I cricket - the most by any country in the shortest format of the sport.
Others: Rinku Singh played an unbeaten knock of 69 runs from 39 balls with two fours and six sixes in his innings.
Rohit Sharma slammed 121 runs off 69 balls with 11 fours and eight sixes in his innings.
